channel.title: Can you get sued for making a private server?
channel.description: Can jagex sue you for making an rsps?

item.title: Can you get sued for making a private server?
item.dc:creator: @Ironiq Ironiq
item.description:
@Ironiq wrote:

They CAN sue you, however if you look at how many servers there are out there they probably wouldn’t even bother. I think you are much more likely to get sued if you use “RS” or “RuneScape” in your server name, or take anything related to the two and act as if they are ‘your property.’

Read full topic
item.source: Can you get sued for making a private server?

item.title: Can you get sued for making a private server?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Best way to stay safe is to have a tos on your site that states that Jagex staff and family are not aloud on the site so you can claim illegal search and seizure.

A tos is not legally binding. It’s like having kiddy porn and saying the fbi isn’t allowed to view it. That wouldn’t work so well.

Jagex and their lawyers send letters threatening to take action, because you are breaking their tos. Which is silly, so mopar added a tos to this site. Neither would be legally binding. Distributing the client or any of their code would be the issue though.
I assume everyone’s seen this a million times. Maybe some haven’t. http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

Read full topic
item.source: Can you get sued for making a private server?

item.title: Can you get sued for making a private server?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Jagex CAN sue you but if they ever take legal action agents you they normally warn you first a few times before cause they don’t normally like to take small things like this to court. Best way to stay safe is to have a tos on your site that states that Jagex staff and family are not aloud on the site so you can claim illegal search and seizure. Also put that the client is legal property of Jagex and don’t claim its your own or registered to the site in anyway. They can’t legally shut your server down since its non of their coding but they can have the website shut down thats hosting your client.

Read full topic
item.source: Can you get sued for making a private server?

item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

yes you can be sued. they more than likely just tell you to shut down or else they will sue you first, though

no you won’t be unless your server gets a lot of attention and donations/payed for things.

i wouldn’t worry about it.

item.title: Can you get sued for making a private server?
item.dc:creator: @Fierystr Fierystr
item.description:
@Fierystr wrote:

eyeownyew:

Certainly. Having an RSPS requires that you use their copyrighted client for other purposes than intended, which is illegal.

Do you think they would sue you? I mean there are so many servers out there right now why aren’t they getting sued?

Read full topic
